chapter.title: Geometry
chapter.p: Now we attempt to leave behind relationships between numbers and between symbols for between shapes and space. We will try, but we still will not make it far. Even as we become more interested in the properties of shapes and the connections between different shapes, numbers, symbols, and formulas will play a role in helping us understand and keep track of various details.

section.title: Square dancing
section.p: We talked about how to use shapes to prove that a^2+b^2 = c^2 when a and b are perpendicular sides of a triangle and c is the hypotenuse.
Given confirmation that various angles were the same in a set of two smaller, subdivided triangles, we looked at a more mechanical derivation of the theorem (see the footnotes of the book, actually).

section.title: Sine Qua Non
section.p: A method of audio compression relies on reducing a complicated wave (see ) into a colection of its simpler components (see , , and ). The labels 'low', 'medium', and 'high' are all relative, but useful for comparison of the images and corresponding sounds. These waves all repeat fairly quickly, which is required if we actually want to hear them. Waves repeating much more slowly could be heard by elephants, while those repeating much more quickly might confuse bats.
